Responsive Navigation

In the "Responsive Navigation" dropdown in the above navigation there are links to different examples of responsive navigation layouts.

The key to all of them is having a "Menu" button that shows up on smaller screens when the main navigation is hidden. Below is an example of what you could use:


<div class="NavBar">
    <button class="SmScBtn js-ssNavBtn"><span class="SmScBtn-icon"></span>Menu</button>
    <ul class="MainNav">....</ul>
</div>

Include 'small-screen-button.css' in src/styles/lib/components/navigation/index.css

Also make sure that src/styles/config.css contains the following custom breakpoints.

    @custom-media --c-bp-smallScreenNav (max-width: 1050px);
    @custom-media --c-bp-largeScreenNav (min-width: 1051px);

Those breakpoints are for when the primary navigation is hidden (--c-bp-smallScreenNav) and when it's displayed (--c-bp-largeScreenNav).
